revised_title: Investigating the Synchronization and Control of Flagellar Movement
tldr: The authors explore the control and synchronization of flagellar movement, investigating how nearby flagella beat with the same frequency and wavelength. They propose that this phenomenon is due to non-linearities in the contractile elements of the flagella, which limit the amplitude of tail oscillation and allow for the suppression of natural oscillation by external waves. This research provides insights into the mechanics of flagella and the processes causing their movement.
